snippet: The Israeli prime minister said that distance and relative strength tended to make the United States view Tehran’s nuclear program differently than his country does.
abstract: Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu says that distance and relative strength makes the United States view Tehran’s nuclear program differently than his country does; reiterates that if Iran does not change course, Israel, which considers a nuclear Iran a threat to its existence, will not allow itself to be in a position where its fate is left in others' hands.
lead_paragraph: The Israeli prime minister said that distance and relative strength tended to make the United States view Tehran’s nuclear program differently than his country does.

headline.seo: Netanyahu Says U.S. and Israel Differ on Urgency of Iran Threat
headline.main: Netanyahu Says U.S. and Israeli ‘Clocks’ Differ on Iran’s Threat
headline.print_headline: Netanyahu Says U.S. and Israeli ‘Clocks’ Differ on Iran’s Threat
